In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **R** serves the following purposes:

- r represents a [rodent](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent"):

  - r [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat")
  - r [giant rat](/wiki/Giant_rat "Giant rat")
  - r [rabid rat](/wiki/Rabid_rat "Rabid rat")
  - r [wererat](/wiki/Wererat "Wererat")
  - r [rock mole](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole")
  - r [woodchuck](/wiki/Woodchuck "Woodchuck")

* R represents a [rust monster or disenchanter](/wiki/Rust_monster_or_disenchanter "Rust monster or disenchanter"), a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") composed of the titular monsters:

  - R [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster")
  - R [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter")

- Press [r]() to [read](/wiki/Read "Read") an object in your inventory.
- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [R]() to [remove](/wiki/Remove "Remove") an item.
- Press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [r]() to [redraw the screen](/wiki/Redraw_screen "Redraw screen").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
  - [2.7 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the giant rat uses the r glyph, and the robber uses the R glyph - in Hack for PDP-11, the R glyph is given to the rust monster. Both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), and continue to use it throughout each version of the game to the modern day.

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [R]() can only be used to take off an accessory, e.g. a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") or an [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet").

## Variants

Variants incorporating the [Convict patch](/wiki/Convict_patch "Convict patch") add at least one new monster to the rodent monster class, so that the Convict starting pet has at least three stages of growth like other domestic starting pets.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the r glyph:

- r rodent:

  - r [rabbit](/wiki/Rabbit "Rabbit")
  - r [black rat](/wiki/Black_rat "Black rat")
  - r [rabid rabbit](/wiki/Rabid_rabbit "Rabid rabbit")
  - r [pack rat](/wiki/Pack_rat "Pack rat")
  - r [hellrat](/wiki/Hellrat "Hellrat")
  - r [The Rat King (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/The_Rat_King_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Rat King (SLASH'EM)")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces two new monsters that use the r and R glyphs, with one coming from the [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch") and the other being part of the incorporated [Convict patch](/wiki/Convict_patch "Convict patch"):

- r rodent:
  - r [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat")
- R rust monster or disenchanter:
  - R [disintegrator](/wiki/Disintegrator "Disintegrator")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces a few new monsters that use the r glyph:

- r rodent:

  - r [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat")
  - r [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")
  - r [witch's familiar](/wiki/Witch%27s_familiar "Witch's familiar")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds several new monsters that use the r and R glyphs:

- r rodent:

  - r [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat")
  - r [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")
  - r [ratman](/index.php?title=Ratman\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ratman (page does not exist)")
  - r [ratman squeaker](/index.php?title=Ratman_squeaker\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ratman squeaker (page does not exist)")
  - r [hellrat](/wiki/Hellrat "Hellrat")
  - r [rat ruler](/wiki/Rat_ruler "Rat ruler")

- R rust monster or disenchanter:
  - R [transmuter](/wiki/Transmuter_\(SpliceHack\) "Transmuter (SpliceHack)")

### EvilHack

EvilHack introduces a few new monsters that use the r glyph:

- r rodent:

  - r [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat")
  - r [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")
  - r [honey badger](/wiki/Honey_badger "Honey badger")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds several new monsters that use the r glyph, including some that are in different monster classes in other variants:

- r [rabbit](/wiki/Rabbit "Rabbit")
- r [hedgehog](/index.php?title=Hedgehog\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hedgehog (page does not exist)")
- r [black rat](/wiki/Black_rat "Black rat")
- r [pack rat](/wiki/Pack_rat "Pack rat")
- r [hellrat](/wiki/Hellrat "Hellrat")
- r [enormous rat](/wiki/Enormous_rat "Enormous rat")
- r [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size "Rodent of unusual size")
- r [skunk](/index.php?title=Skunk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Skunk (page does not exist)")
- r [rabid rabbit](/wiki/Rabid_rabbit "Rabid rabbit")
- r [giant badger](/wiki/Giant_badger "Giant badger")
- r [honey badger](/wiki/Honey_badger "Honey badger")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters that use the r glyph added in SLASH'EM, and adds another monster that uses the R glyphs:

- R rust monster or disenchanter:
  - R [disintegrator](/wiki/Disintegrator "Disintegrator")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

R

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter R serves the following purposes:

  • r represents a rodent:
    • r sewer rat
    • r giant rat
    • r rabid rat
    • r wererat
    • r rock mole
    • r woodchuck
  • R represents a rust monster or disenchanter, a monster class composed of the titular monsters:
    • R rust monster
    • R disenchanter
  • Press r to read an object in your inventory.
  • Press shift + R to remove an item.
  • Press ctrl + r to redraw the screen.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 UnNetHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack
    • 2.4 SpliceHack
    • 2.5 EvilHack
    • 2.6 Hack'EM
    • 2.7 SlashTHEM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, the giant rat uses the r glyph, and the robber uses the R glyph - in Hack for PDP-11, the R glyph is given to the rust monster. Both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in Hack 1.0, and continue to use it throughout each version of the game to the modern day.

In NetHack 3.4.3 and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, shift + R can only be used to take off an accessory, e.g. a ring or an amulet.

Variants

Variants incorporating the Convict patch add at least one new monster to the rodent monster class, so that the Convict starting pet has at least three stages of growth like other domestic starting pets.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the r glyph:

  • r rodent:
    • r rabbit
    • r black rat
    • r rabid rabbit
    • r pack rat
    • r hellrat
    • r The Rat King (SLASH'EM)

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces two new monsters that use the r and R glyphs, with one coming from the biodiversity patch and the other being part of the incorporated Convict patch:

  • r rodent:
    • r enormous rat
  • R rust monster or disenchanter:
    • R disintegrator

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces a few new monsters that use the r glyph:

  • r rodent:
    • r enormous rat
    • r rodent of unusual size
    • r witch's familiar

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds several new monsters that use the r and R glyphs:

  • r rodent:
    • r enormous rat
    • r rodent of unusual size
    • r ratman
    • r ratman squeaker
    • r hellrat
    • r rat ruler
  • R rust monster or disenchanter:
    • R transmuter

EvilHack

EvilHack introduces a few new monsters that use the r glyph:

  • r rodent:
    • r enormous rat
    • r rodent of unusual size
    • r honey badger

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds several new monsters that use the r glyph, including some that are in different monster classes in other variants:

  • r rabbit
  • r hedgehog
  • r black rat
  • r pack rat
  • r hellrat
  • r enormous rat
  • r rodent of unusual size
  • r skunk
  • r rabid rabbit
  • r giant badger
  • r honey badger

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters that use the r glyph added in SLASH'EM, and adds another monster that uses the R glyphs:

  • R rust monster or disenchanter:
    • R disintegrator
